newsitem.title: ISRAEL: RESEARCH ALERT-BZW raises Agis estimate.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT-BZW raises Agis estimate.

text.p: BZW Research said it raised its earnings estimate for Israel's Agis Industries, the cosmetics and pharmaceuticals firm, citing an improved outlook for operating margins in the next two years.
"Full year 1996 results were slightly better than our expectations. EPS (earnings per share) was 1.64 shekels compared to the 1.6 shekels we expected," BZW said in a report.
"In 1997 we expect EPS of 2.1 shekels ($0.66) compared to our previous estimate of $0.57."
BZW said soap maker Neca, which Agis acquired earlier this year, will be profitable in 1997 following losses in the last few years.
"In our previous estimates we assumed it will take some time to turn around Neca's operations," BZW said in a report.
